tagged_content.title: £100 million to expand early education and childcare
tagged_content.description: Early education and childcare providers are to receive £100 million to help them meet a growing demand for places.

tagged_content.title: £4 million to fund free nursery places in 15 areas
tagged_content.description: From today 15 local authorities will benefit from £4 million of government funding to provide free early learning and childcare to the most disadvantaged two year olds in their communities.

tagged_content.title: 92,000 2-year-olds already receiving free childcare
tagged_content.description: Around 92,000 of the most disadvantaged 2-year-olds are now receiving up to 15 hours a week of fully funded childcare.

tagged_content.title: A year until first working parents receive doubled free childcare

tagged_content.title: Childcare costs scheme for working families announced by David Cameron
tagged_content.description: Childcare scheme will be worth up to £1,200 per child, and will save a typical working family with 2 children under 12 up to £2,400 a year.

tagged_content.title: Children who have early education get higher GCSEs
tagged_content.description: Research shows that a pre-schooled child has more chance of getting better exam results and ultimately earning higher wages.

tagged_content.title: Coalition government to reward local authorities for improving children's lives
tagged_content.description: Local authorities will be paid according to the prevalence of breastfeeding and the take up of free nursery care, under a new scheme being trialled by the Coalition Government.

tagged_content.description: Deputy Prime Minister Nick Clegg has outlined plans to give couples more freedom to organise their parental leave after the birth of a baby.

tagged_content.description: Early years apprenticeship bursary doubles as part of the government’s drive to attract high-quality candidates to the profession.

It has 2 key objectives: to provide salient, up-to-date information on parents' use of childcare and early years provision, and to continue the time series - which has now been running for over 10 years - on issues covered throughout the survey series.

tagged_content.description: Childcare and Education Minister Sam Gyimah urges parents to check the support available for families to help with the cost of childcare.

tagged_content.title: Sam Gyimah: childcare - our moral mission
tagged_content.description: Childcare Minister Sam Gyimah discusses what childcare providers can do to deliver what is wanted by the modern working family.

tagged_content.title: Sarah Teather article in 'Nursery World' on the Spending Review
tagged_content.description: Children's Minister Sarah Teather writes in 'Nursery World' on the Spending Review and the early learning and childcare sector.

tagged_content.title: Sarah Teather sets out overarching vision for early years services in 'Nursery World'
tagged_content.description: The Children's Minister, Sarah Teather, outlines some of the commitments the government is making to early years provision.

tagged_content.title: Sarah Teather speaks to the Daycare Trust
tagged_content.description: Sarah Teather, Children's Minister, addresses the Daycare Trust.

tagged_content.title: Sarah Teather to Daycare Trust annual conference
tagged_content.description: The Minister of State for Children and Families talks about the government's agenda for early years provision, including plans for Sure Start children's centres.

tagged_content.title: Written ministerial statement by Edward Timpson on Voluntary and Community Sector Prospectus
tagged_content.description: Children's Minister Edward Timpson said the Department for Education is today publishing a National Prospectus launching our new Grants Programme for 2013-15.

tagged_content.title: Written ministerial statement by Michael Gove on schools financial settlement - education spending
tagged_content.description: Education Secretary Michael Gove's written ministerial statement on the schools financial settlement with regard to education spending.

tagged_content.title: FOI: Early years dataset as at 31 August 2014
tagged_content.description: These statistics are published in accordance with Freedom of Information (FOI) legislation.

tagged_content.title: Childcare and early years providers survey: 2011
tagged_content.description: This report covers the latest findings from the Department for Education's regular survey of childcare and early years providers. The survey collects information on the characteristics of both providers and the workforce, including number of places and children and the qualifications of staff.

tagged_content.title: Childcare and early years survey of parents: 2012 to 2013
tagged_content.description: Report providing the main findings of the November 2012 to June 2013 survey from the childcare and early years survey of parents series.

tagged_content.title: Provision for children under 5 years of age: January 2014
tagged_content.description: Statistics on early years provision for children under 5 years in the maintained, private, voluntary and independent sectors in England.
